sentences: Daniel Sedgwick (1814â€“1879) was an English hymnologist and bookseller.
Daniel was born in London and baptised on 25 December 1814 at St Katherine Cree church, London.
He was apprenticed as a shoemaker but in 1837 gave up his profession and started to sell books.
Daniel died on 10 March 1879; his wife Hannah was the executor of his will.
His manuscripts were used by John D. Julian in preparing the Dictionary of Hymnology of 1892.
